Take-home Exercise - Application of Spatial Point Patterns Analysis

Discover the geographical distribution of functional and non-function water points in Osun State, Nigeria

Author

Pierre HAAS

Published

February 18, 2023

Modified

February 20, 2023

1 Getting started

1.1 Installing and Loading Packages

pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, sp, tmap, plyr, tidyverse, readxl)

1.2 Importing data

1.2.1 Geospatial data

dki = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial",
             layer = "BATAS_DESA_DESEMBER_2019_DUKCAPIL_DKI_JAKARTA")
Reading layer `BATAS_DESA_DESEMBER_2019_DUKCAPIL_DKI_JAKARTA' from data source 
  `C:\p-haas\IS415\Take-home_Ex\Take-home_Ex02\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 269 features and 161 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 106.3831 ymin: -6.370815 xmax: 106.9728 ymax: -5.184322
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
dki %>%
  st_crs()
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: WGS 84 
  wkt:
GEOGCRS["WGS 84",
    DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
        ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
    PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
        ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
    CS[ellipsoidal,2],
        AXIS["latitude",north,
            ORDER[1],
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        AXIS["longitude",east,
            ORDER[2],
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
    ID["EPSG",4326]]
dki = dki %>%
  st_transform(crs=23837)

1.2.2 Aspatial data

vaccination = read_excel("data/aspatial/July.xlsx") %>%
  select(2,3,4,5,6,9)

colnames(vaccination)[6] = "Vaccine Administered July"

months = c('August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December', 'January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June')
count = 0

for (i in months){
  count = count + 1
  filename = paste("data/aspatial/", i, ".xlsx", sep = "")
  df = read_excel(filename)
  
  colnb = ifelse(count < 8, 9, 10)
  colnames(df)[colnb] = paste( "Vaccine Administered", i)
  cleaned_df = df %>%
    select(4, colnb)
  
  vaccination = vaccination %>%
    merge(cleaned_df, by='KELURAHAN')
}
